availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Franklin County, Kentucky, jailer. Maryland native. Married to Mariah Holton Luckett in Franklin County, Kentucky, on June 16, 1814. Father of Mary E. Luckett, Monarcha E. Luckett Taylor, and Anne Fenwick Luckett. Resident of Franklin County, Kentucky, in 1830. Owned six enslaved persons in Franklin County in 1830. Resident of Franklin County in 1840. Owned four enslaved persons in Franklin County in 1840. County jailer in Franklin County in 1850. Owned ten enslaved persons in Franklin County in 1850. Owned Ben [Unknown] in Franklin County in 1855. Owned Tom [Unknown] in Franklin County in 1859. Resident of Frankfort, Franklin County, in 1860. Household owned one enslaved person in Frankfort in 1860.
